definition: lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
surname San
three/3
evening/sunset
four/4

sentences.english: That guy has a bad reputation of play fast and loose with the girls around him.
sentences.chinese: 那家伙名声很坏，对待他四周的女孩们朝三暮四。

sentences.english: While she always criticized the fickleness of human nature.
sentences.chinese: 她一方面总是批评人的本性朝三暮四。

sentences.english: Jane claims that men are all two-timers .
sentences.chinese: 简说男人都是朝三暮四的家伙。

sentences.english: Try not to marry a person who is as changeable as the weather.
sentences.chinese: 不要与一位朝三暮四的人结婚。

sentences.english: He was very changeable, often blowing hot and cold.
sentences.chinese: 他朝三暮四，老是反复无常。

definition: to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
serve Qin in the morning Chu in the evening (idiom); quick to switch sides
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
fickle in love/sentimentality
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
lit. eyeing what's in the pot as one eats from one's bowl (idiom)/not content with what one already has/(of men, typically) to have the wandering eye
pinyin: chi1 zhe5 wan3 li3 , kan4 zhe5 guo1 li3

definition: lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
see 腳踏兩隻船|脚踏两只船[jiao3 ta4 liang3 zhi1 chuan2]
(coll.) womanizer/skirt-chaser
to cease to be faithful
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
fickle (woman)
single-minded/concentrated
